articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan worked to restore power to more than 40,000 households after Typhoon Haikui barrelled into the east and south of the island, as cities and counties in the affected areas closed schools and businesses and domestic airlines cancelled flights.
articles.title: Thousands without power after Typhoon Haikui batters Taiwan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Madrid's mayor on Sunday advised all residents to stay at home as the capital braced itself for torrential rain and storms affecting parts of Spain.
articles.title: Madrid residents told to stay at home as torrential rain sweeps across Spain

articles.author: Sudarshan Varadhan, Carman Chew
articles.description: India has stepped up the use of coal to generate electricity in a bid to stop outages caused by lower hydroelectricity output, and as an increase in renewables is struggling to keep pace with record power demand.
articles.title: India steps up coal use to stop outages triggered by unusually dry weather

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese nationals, sometimes posing as tourists, have accessed military bases and sensitive sites in the U.S. as many as 100 times in recent years, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing U.S. officials who described the incidents as potential espionage threats.
articles.title: Chinese gatecrashers at US bases raise espionage concerns -WSJ

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: In October 1943, after the Nazis began a brutal occupation of their former ally, German troops hanged six Italian civilians on a hillside in southern Italy as collective punishment for the killing of a soldier, who had been foraging for food.
articles.title: Eighty years on, Italian victims of Nazi crimes finally to get compensation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of supporters celebrated the nomination of Mexican Senator Xochitl Galvez on Sunday as the 2024 presidential candidate of an opposition alliance set to take on the country's ruling party.
articles.title: Mexican Senator Xochitl Galvez hailed as opposition candidate for 2024 election

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Senior U.S. officials visited Syria's eastern oil-rich Deir al Zor province on Sunday in an attempt to defuse an uprising by Arab tribes against Kurdish rule that is destabilising northeast Syria, U.S. officials, security sources, and residents said.
articles.title: U.S. officials visit Syria's Deir al Zor in bid to defuse Arab tribal unrest

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Sunday that he was disappointed that Chinese President Xi Jinping was not attending the summit of G20 leaders in India, but added that he was going to "get to see him."
articles.title: Biden says disappointed China's Xi will not attend G20 summit

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he had decided to replace his defence minister, setting the stage for the biggest shake-up of Ukraine's defence establishment since Russia launched its full-scale invasion in February 2022.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy moves to replace wartime defense minister

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: More than half of Australians would reject the inclusion of an Indigenous advisory panel in the constitution, a newspaper poll showed on Monday, as the government struggles to lift support for the landmark proposal ahead of a vote in about six weeks.
articles.title: More than half of Australians oppose Indigenous panel in constitution, poll shows
